chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio Alejandro Arauza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Court authorizes transfer to jail most convenient to defendant's employment/residence.
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Defendant Julio Alejandro Arauza in court.  Attorney Sara Kneevers in court for Julio Alejandro Arauza.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel J Gabler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information. Information shall be filed within 48 hours. Atty. Gabler moves to dismiss & read-in Ct. 1 & 3. Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2. Court finds def guilty on Ct 2. Court orders Ct. 1 & 3 dismissed & read-in. Statements by Atty. Gabler; statements by Atty. Kneevers. Statements by Court; Court proceeds to sentencing. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.

(Fond du Lac Co. 21CF922; 21TR7333; 21TR7334)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  Atty. State requests $2,500.00 cash bond.  Atty. Drewa argues for $750-800.00 cash bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.
